MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyDictionary<string,object> ParseConditionalCompilationSymbols (string symbolList, out System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Diagnostic> diagnostics, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair<string,object>> symbols = null);

.method public static class System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyDictionary`2<string, object> ParseConditionalCompilationSymbols(string symbolList, [out] class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Diagnostic>& diagnostics, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<valuetype System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair`2<string, object>> symbols) cil managed

Public Shared Function ParseConditionalCompilationSymbols (symbolList As String, ByRef diagnostics As IEnumerable(Of Diagnostic), Optional symbols As IEnumerable(Of KeyValuePair(Of String, Object)) = null) As IReadOnlyDictionary(Of String, Object)
static member ParseConditionalCompilationSymbols : string * * seq<System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair<string, obj>> -> System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyDictionary<string, obj>

Docs.param: The conditional compilation string. This takes the form of a comma delimited list of NAME=Value pairs, where Value may be a quoted string or integer.
A collection of reported diagnostics during parsing of symbolList, can be empty IEnumerable.
A collection representing existing symbols. Symbols parsed from will be merged with this dictionary.
Docs.summary: Parses Conditional Compilations Symbols. Given the string of conditional compilation symbols from the project system, parse them and merge them with an IReadOnlyDictionary ready to be given to the compilation.
